text: The 2019–20 Colorado Avalanche season was the 41st season for the National Hockey League franchise that was established on June 22, 1979, and 24th season since the franchise relocated from Quebec prior to the start of the 1995–96 NHL season. The Avalanche advanced to the playoffs for the third straight season, after last missing the playoffs in the 2016–17 season. The season was suspended by the league officials on March 12, 2020, after several other professional and collegiate sports organizations followed suit as a result of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic. Two of the Avalanche's players tested positive for COVID-19. On May 26, the NHL regular season was officially declared over with the remaining games being cancelled. In the Playoffs, the Avalanche defeated the Arizona Coyotes in five games in the first round, before losing to the Dallas Stars in seven games in the second round. ==Standings== ===Divisional standings=== ===Western Conference=== ;Tiebreaking procedures # Fewer number of games played (only used during regular season). # Greater number of regulation wins (denoted by RW). # Greater amount of wins in regulation and overtime (excluding shootout wins; denoted by ROW). # Greater amount of total wins (including shootouts). # Greater number of points earned in head-to-head play; if teams played an uneven number of head-to-head games, the result of the first game on the home ice of the team with the extra home game is discarded. # Greater goal differential (difference between goals for and goals against). # Greater amount of goals scored (denoted by GF). ==Schedule and results== ===Preseason=== The preseason schedule was published on June 13, 2019. {| class="toccolours collapsible collapsed" style="width:90%; clear:both; margin:1.5em auto; text-align:center;" |- ! colspan="10" style="background:#FFFFFF; border-top:#6F263D 5px solid; border- bottom:#236192 5px solid;"|2019 preseason game log: 2–3–1 (Home: 1–2–0 ; Road: 1–1–1) |- style="background:#ddd;" ! # !! Home |- style="background:#;" | 71 || March 13 || Vancouver || Colorado |- style="background:#;" | 72 || March 15 || Vegas || Colorado |- style="background:#;" | 73 || March 17 || San Jose || Colorado |- style="background:#;" | 74 || March 19 || Colorado || Nashville |- style="background:#;" | 75 || March 21 || Montreal || Colorado |- style="background:#;" | 76 || March 23 || Colorado || Minnesota |- style="background:#;" | 77 || March 25 || Edmonton || Colorado |- style="background:#;" | 78 || March 27 || Colorado || Winnipeg |- style="background:#;" | 79 || March 29 || Nashville || Colorado |- style="background:#;" | 80 || March 31 || Arizona || Colorado |- style="background:#;" | 81 || April 2 || Winnipeg || Colorado |- style="background:#;" | 82 || April 4 || St. Louis || Colorado |} |- | colspan="11" style="text-align:center;"| Legend: |} === Playoffs === The Avalanche played in a round-robin tournament to determine their seed for the playoffs. Colorado finished with a 2–0–1 record to clinch the second seed for the playoffs. The Avalanche faced the Arizona Coyotes in the first round and defeated them in five games. The Avalanche faced the Dallas Stars in the second round, but lost in seven games. {| class="toccolours" style="width:90%; clear:both; margin:1.5em auto; text-align:center;" |- ! colspan=10 style="background:#FFFFFF; border-top:#6F263D 5px solid; border-bottom:#236192 5px solid;"|2020 Stanley Cup playoffs |- | colspan=10 | {| class="toccolours collapsible collapsed" style="width:100%;" |- ! colspan=10 style="background:#FFFFFF; border-top:#6F263D 2px solid; border-bottom:#236192 2px solid;"|Western Conference Seeding Round-robin |- style="background:#ddd;" ! # !!
